intro: Galium kiirunense, commonly known as the Kiirun silverweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of northern Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, stoloniferous stems that spread along the ground. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Galium kiirunense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
